page.title: 05The Hamlet of Wheatcroft
page.content: Wheatcroft hamlet is mainly a farming community with no industry in Wheatcroft itself. The name Wheatcroft comes from,{"wheat"-}crops of wheat and{"croft"-}area of land. Wheatcroft is set in Crich Parish with the oldest building being Cruck Barn, at Beech Tree Farm built around the mid 1400's. There is a small Independent non-Conformist Chapel although it has been closed for many years, it is beleived to have been established in the late 1600's. One of the oldest families of Wheatcroft was the{Kirkland family}who first came to Wheatcroft in 1545. In 1652 a{John Kirkland}of Wheatcroft died and left a charity of 40 shillings a year for the poor of Wheatcroft. This charity still survives and makes a payment to people at Christmas.
